channel.title: Heres the problem
channel.description:
I have about 343GB of movies on my external harddrive. Today I started the transfer of about 6 4gb files all at once and transferred them to my WD 500gb external harddrive. It worked and I took the harddrive up stairs after safley removing it via windows. When I got up staris it showed 106 files (100 files before the 6 I added) then it wouldnt play the file so I safley removed and then plugged it back in. It shows that the space was used but it only shows 100 files. WHAT THE FUCK IS WRONG WITH YOU WINDOWS. So now it shows 20gb being used that isnt there (or is there but I cant access it). I try and repair it via windows properties but that doesnt do anything. I right click the folder it shows 363GB then I go in the folder and highlight all the files and right click, this shows 347. WHAT THE FUCK IS WRONG WITH YOU WINDOWS. Its not hidden files already try that. I cut the files from my computer to my harddrive and now there gone. WHERE THEY AT!
THANKS WINDOWS. Great CHKDSK just deleted all that and now I get to redownload 20gbs of data. FUCK WINDOWS!
I guess im going to have to set up a fucking raid of external harddrives just to make sure I dont fucking lose anything. WIndows sucks.

item.title: Heres the problem
item.dc:creator: @mwiebelhaus mwiebelhaus
item.description:
@mwiebelhaus wrote:

I know I just hate it over all. The only distro I really ever enjoyed was Sabayon, but I don’t like their newer releases.

Read full topic

item.title: Heres the problem
item.dc:creator: @Speljohan Speljohan
item.description:
@Speljohan wrote:

There’s more than 1 distro…

Read full topic

item.title: Heres the problem
item.dc:creator: @mwiebelhaus mwiebelhaus
item.description:
@mwiebelhaus wrote:

I hate Windows, but I hate linux more.

Why, because I want to play games (COD4MW, COD4MW2). Plus they dont make peerblock for linux. Plus this ended up being my fault because It was actually writing files when I unhooked it. Linux has the same problem anyway both windows and linux want you to (safley remove hardware) unless this has changed since the last time I used ubuntu.

Read full topic

im going to have to set up a fucking raid of external harddrives just to make sure I dont fucking lose anything.

If you hate it the same amount as I do, go use Linux?
